title: New: FAMY – Mother Benita / DOGG DOGG
content:
Having changed their name from FAMILY to FAMY a couple of weeks back, the London based folk-pop outfit have now complicated things even more by removing the majority of their music from their bandcamp site. However, don’t fret son, as they still have a handful of tracks to stream and download over at their soundcloud; although I suspect it won’t be long before these disappear as well. Alongside this mystery building, the group have also announced their first physical release, a 12″ featuring a re-recorded version of Mother Benita and a new track on the B-side in the form of DOGG DOGG.

Both tracks were recorded in December, with the help of WU LYF guitarist Evans, and continue in the church-choir influenced vein that we’ve come to expect from the London outfit. Mother Benita glides in somewhere between Noah and the Whale and Guided By Voices; harmonious, tender and moving, yet without straying too far from their comfort zone. B-Side DOGG DOGG is arguably the more admirable track, with the lead singer yearning ‘you let go of the things that you know’, proving instantaneously intriguing. Towards the latter half of the track, the now stereotypical reverb-laden guitar of Evans (WU LYF) can be heard, alongside shrieked vocals, vaguely reminiscent of their Manchester friends. With these two tracks, FAMY have well and truly reasserted the belief that 2012 is destined to be a big year for them.
author: 5e9b68b27a1236eccfeb1d27
